data.enText: a particular part or feature of a situation, an idea, a problem, etc.; a way in which it may be considered

data.chText: 这本书旨在涵盖城市生活的各个方面。
data.enText: The book aims to cover all aspects of city life.

data.chText: 这场辩论最重要的方面
data.enText: the most important aspect of the debate

data.chText: 她觉得她已从各个角度考虑了这个问题。
data.enText: She felt she had looked at the problem from every aspect.

data.chText: 这是他过去没有了解到的她的性格的一个方面。
data.enText: This was one aspect of her character he hadn't seen before.
the appearance of a place, a situation or a person

data.chText: 事情开始呈现较为不祥的征兆。
data.enText: Events began to take on a more sinister aspect.
the direction in which a building, window, piece of land, etc. faces; the side of a building which faces a particular direction

data.chText: （动词的）体（如表示动作等发生一次或多次、已完成或正在进行）
data.enText: the form of a verb that shows, for example, whether the action happens once or repeatedly, is completed or still continuing

simple_means.memory_skill: a 加强 + spect 看 → 让人看的东西 → 容貌

means: （动词的）体（如表示动作等发生一次或多次、已完成或正在进行）

ex.chText: 这个地区看上去肮脏不堪。
ex.enText: The area has a very dirty look to it.
He has a tired look in his eyes.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，指人或事物的外表，较口语化，用于复数时可指美貌。

ex.chText: 他的容貌有了明显的变化。
ex.enText: There was a noticeable transformation in his appearance.
We should not judge a person by his appearance.

ex.chText: 它破坏了整幢建筑的外观。
ex.enText: It spoiled the appearance of the whole building.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指相对内在而言，某人或某物给人的印象。

ex.chText: 那个店员的一脸凶相把顾客吓走了。
ex.enText: The fierce aspect of the salesman frightened the customer off.

ex.chText: 闪电使屋里显得非常可怕。
ex.enText: The lightning gave the room a scary aspect.

synonyms.bx: 侧重指人或事物在某一时间呈现的样子。

tr: the feelings expressed on a person's face
a distinct feature or element in a problem
example: he studied every facet of the question

tr: the visual percept of a region
example: the most desirable feature of the park are the beautiful views

tr: the beginning or duration or completion or repetition of the action of a verb

value.def: An aspect of something is one of the parts of its character or nature.

example.ex: Climate and weather affect every aspect of our lives...
example.tran: 气候和天气影响着我们生活的方方面面。

example.ex: He was interested in all aspects of the work here...
example.tran: 他对这里工作的所有方面都感兴趣。

example.ex: Monroe described the financial aspect as crucial.
example.tran: 门罗认为金融方面至关重要。

value.def: The aspect of a building or window is the direction in which it faces.

example.ex: The house had a south-west aspect.

value.def: If something begins to have a new aspect, it begins to have a new appearance or quality.

example.ex: Our journey had taken on a new aspect. The countryside was no longer familiar...
example.tran: 我们所到之地呈现出一派新景象。乡村变得不再熟悉。

example.ex: The snowy street, like the church, assumed a dumb, lifeless aspect.
example.tran: 积雪覆盖的街道就像教堂一样，显得沉闷、毫无生气。

value.def: In grammar, aspect is the way that a verb group shows whether an activity is continuing, is repeated, or is completed. For example, in 'They were laughing', the verb is in the progressive aspect and shows that the action was continuing.

trans: 方位角；视线角；扫描角；视界角
非完整体；未完成體；未完成体；非完成体
进行体；进行态；动词进行体；进行貌；进行式
维持外观 维持外观；维持外观

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 加强 + spect 看 → 让人看的东西 → 容貌
au〔= av 鸟〕+ spic 看 + e → 看到鸟〔喜鹊〕→ 吉兆
au〔= av 鸟〕+ spic 看 + ious …的 → 吉兆的
circum 周围 + spect 看 → 环顾周围 → 慎重的
circum 环绕，周围 + spect 看 + ion 表状态 → 慎重；细心
con 加强 + spic 看 + uous …的 →〔被人〕看了又看 → 显眼的
de 否定 + spic 看 + able 可…的 → 不值得看的 → 可鄙的
de 否定 + spis〔= spic〕看 + e → 不想看的 → 轻视
ex 加强 + pect〔=spect〕看 → 都在看，翘首以待 → 期待
ex 加强 + pect〔=spect〕看 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 期待
in 向内 + spect 看 → 进去看 → 检查；视察
in 向内 + spect 看 + ion 表名词 → 检查；视察
per 贯穿 + spect 看 + ive 表名词 → 透过…看 → 透视
per 贯穿 + spic 看 + acious 有…性质的 → 看透的 → 有洞察力的
pro 向前 + spect 看 → 向前看 → 展望
pro 向前 + spect 看 + ive …的 → 将来的
pro 向前 + spect 看 + us 表名词，用于科学术语 → 展望未来时草拟的东西 → 计划书；大纲
re 一再 + spect 看 → 一再注视 → 尊敬
re 一再 + spect 看 + able 可…的，respect的形容词 → 可敬的
re 一再 + spect 看 + ful …的，respect的形容词 → 充满敬意的
retro 向后 + spect 看 → 向后看 → 回顾
retro 向后；回；反 + spect 看 + ive 有…性质的 → 回顾的
spect 看 + acle 表抽象名词 → 戴上眼镜让你看到幻觉 → 奇观；眼镜
来自spectacle“奇观”
spect 看 + ator 表人 → 观看的人 → 观众
specul 看 + ate 做，造成，使… → 看准 → 投机 → 做投机买卖要经过周密思索 → 思索
sus 下 + pect〔=spect〕看 → 在下面偷偷看 → 怀疑
sus 下，后 + pic〔=spic〕看 + ion 表名词 → 在下面看来看去 → 怀疑
sus 下，后 + pic〔=spic〕看 + ious …的 → 多疑的
